briefTitle: A Study of Valcyte (Valganciclovir) CMV Prophylaxis After Renal Transplantation

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Participants With Active Cytomegalovirus (CMV) Infection Within 12 Months
outcomeMeasures.description: Active CMV infection was defined as plasma polymerase chain reaction (PCR) ≥ 400 copies/millilitre (ml).

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Participants With CMV Disease Within 12 Months Including CMV Syndrome and Tissue Invasive Disease
outcomeMeasures.description: CMV disease comprises the two components of CMV syndrome as well as CMV tissue invasive disease. CMV syndrome was defined as viremia according to plasma PCR ≥ 400 copies/ml and at least one of the following signs: fever of ≥38 °C; new or increased malaise (malaise defined as normal activity reduced \>50%; cannot work or unable to care for self; leukopenia on 2 successive measurements separated by at least 24 hours thrombocytopenia; elevation of hepatic transaminases (alanine aminotransferase (ALT) or aspartate aminotransferase (AST) to at least 2 x upper limit of normal (ULN). CMV tissue invasive disease was defined as viremia according plasma PCR ≥ 400 copies/ml and clinical evidence of localized CMV infection (CMV inclusion cells or in situ detection of CMV antigen or deoxyribonucleic acid \[DNA\] by immunostaining or hybridization, respectively), cerebral spinal fluid \[CSF\]) and/or relevant symptoms or signs of organ dysfunction.

outcomeMeasures.title: Urine Proteomic Pattern at Month 12
outcomeMeasures.description: Proteomics is the complete set of proteins expressed by an organism, tissue, or cell. Urine proteomic pattern was measured on a scale between -1, indicating no graft alteration, and +1, indicating graft alteration.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Participants With Graft Loss at Month 84
Percentage of Participants With CMV Syndrome Within 12 Months
outcomeMeasures.description: CMV syndrome was defined as viremia according to plasma PCR ≥ 400 copies/ml and at least one of the following signs: fever of ≥38 °C; new or increased malaise (malaise defined as normal activity reduced \>50%; cannot work or unable to care for self; leukopenia on 2 successive measurements separated by at least 24 hours thrombocytopenia; elevation of hepatic transaminases (alanine aminotransferase (ALT) or aspartate aminotransferase (AST) to at least 2 x upper limit of normal (ULN).

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Participants With CMV Tissue Invasive Disease Within 12 Months
outcomeMeasures.description: CMV tissue invasive disease was defined as viremia: PCR ≥ 400 copies/ml and clinical evidence of localized CMV infection (CMV inclusion cells or in situ detection of CMV antigen or deoxyribonucleic acid \[DNA\] by immunostaining or hybridization, respectively), cerebral spinal fluid \[CSF\]) and/or relevant symptoms or signs of organ dysfunction.

outcomeMeasures.title: Time to Occurrence of First Viremia Within 12 Months
outcomeMeasures.description: Viremia was defined as plasma PCR ≥ 400 copies/ml.

outcomeMeasures.title: Viral Burden at Viremia
outcomeMeasures.description: Time-weighted area under the curve (AUC) of the polymerase chain reaction (PCR). Viremia was defined as plasma PCR ≥ 400 copies/ml.

outcomeMeasures.title: Creatinine Clearance at Month 12
outcomeMeasures.description: Creatinine clearance was estimated using the Cockcroft-Gault formula.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Participants With at Least One Treated and Biopsy-Proven Acute Rejection Episode Within 12 Months
Days of Hospitalization
Relationship Between Proteomics Pattern and Graft Survival
outcomeMeasures.description: Proteomics is the complete set of proteins expressed by an organism, tissue, or cell. The proteomics of CKD273, CMV, and nephropathy was measured on a scale between -1, indicating no graft alteration, and +1, indicating graft alteration.

outcomeMeasures.title: Relationship Between Proteomics Pattern and Participant Survival
outcomeMeasures.description: Proteomics is the complete set of proteins expressed by an organism, tissue, or cell. The proteomics of CKD273, CMV, and nephropathy was measured on a scale between -1, indicating no graft alteration, and +1, indicating graft alteration.

outcomeMeasures.title: Proteomics Parameter: CKD273
outcomeMeasures.description: Proteomics is the complete set of proteins expressed by an organism, tissue, or cell. The proteomics of CKD273 was measured on a scale between -1, indicating no graft alteration, and +1, indicating graft alteration.

outcomeMeasures.title: Proteomics Parameter: CMV
outcomeMeasures.description: Proteomics is the complete set of proteins expressed by an organism, tissue, or cell. The proteomics of CMV was measured on a scale between -1, indicating no graft alteration, and +1, indicating graft alteration.

outcomeMeasures.title: Proteomics Parameter: Nephropathy
outcomeMeasures.description: Proteomics is the complete set of proteins expressed by an organism, tissue, or cell. The proteomics of nephropathy was measured on a scale between -1, indicating no graft alteration, and +1, indicating graft alteration.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Participants Surviving at Month 12
Percentage of Participants With Graft Survival at Month 12
Percentage of Participants With Leukopenia Within 12 Months
outcomeMeasures.description: Leukopenia: white blood cell (WBC) of \< 3,500/microlitre (μL) and \< 1,000/μL

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Participants With Neutropenia Within 12 Months
outcomeMeasures.description: Neutropenia: absolute neutrophil count (ANC) \< 750/μL within 12 months.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Participants With Any Opportunistic Infection Within 12 Months

Percentage of Participants With Active CMV Infections Not Responding to Valganciclovir or IV Ganciclovir Treatment
outcomeMeasures.description: Active CMV infection was defined as plasma polymerase chain reaction (PCR) ≥ 400 copies/millilitre (ml).

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Participants With CMV Viremia (Active CMV Infection) From Baseline to Month 24 and Every 12 Months up to Month 84
outcomeMeasures.description: Viremia (active CMV Infection) was defined as PCR ≥ 400 copies/ml.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Participants With CMV Disease From Baseline to Month 24 and Every 12 Months up to Month 84
outcomeMeasures.description: CMV disease comprises the two components of CMV syndrome as well as CMV tissue invasive disease. CMV syndrome was defined as viremia according to plasma PCR ≥ 400 copies/ml and at least one of the following signs: fever of ≥38 °C; new or increased malaise (malaise defined as normal activity reduced \>50%; cannot work or unable to care for self; leukopenia on 2 successive measurements separated by at least 24 hours thrombocytopenia; elevation of hepatic transaminases (alanine aminotransferase (ALT) or aspartate aminotransferase (AST) to at least 2 x upper limit of normal (ULN). outcomeMeasures.description: Active CMV infection was defined as plasma polymerase chain reaction (PCR) ≥ 400 copies/millilitre (ml).

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Participants With CMV Disease After Month 24 and Every 12 Months up to Month 84
outcomeMeasures.description: CMV disease comprises the two components of CMV syndrome as well as CMV tissue invasive disease. CMV syndrome was defined as viremia according to plasma PCR ≥ 400 copies/ml and at least one of the following signs: fever of ≥38 °C; new or increased malaise (malaise defined as normal activity reduced \>50%; cannot work or unable to care for self; leukopenia on 2 successive measurements separated by at least 24 hours thrombocytopenia; elevation of hepatic transaminases (alanine aminotransferase (ALT) or aspartate aminotransferase (AST) to at least 2 x upper limit of normal (ULN). outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Participants Surviving at Month 24 and Every 12 Months up to Month 84
Number of Participants Who Died From Months 24 to Month 84
Percentage of Participants With Graft Survival at Month 24 and Every 12 Months up to Month 84
Number of Participants Who Had Lost Their Transplant up to Month 84
Number of Participants With Active CMV Infection Who Had Lost Their Transplant up to Month 84
Number of Participants Without Active CMV Infection Who Had Lost Their Transplant up to Month 84
Kaplan-Meier Estimate of the Percentage of Participants (With Versus Without Active CMV Infection) on Valganciclovir CMV Prophylaxis With First Occurrence of Graft Loss at Month 84
outcomeMeasures.description: An analysis for the time to first occurrence of graft loss within month 84 (by means of Kaplan-Meier analysis) was done for all patients who suffered at least once from acute CMV infection (CMV viremia) during this study versus all patients who did not suffer from acute CMV infection (CMV viremia) during the study. Active CMV infection was defined as plasma polymerase chain reaction (PCR) ≥ 400 copies/millilitre (ml).

outcomeMeasures.title: Kaplan-Meier Estimate of the Percentage of Participants (With Versus Without Active CMV Infection) on Pre-emptive CMV Therapy With First Occurrence of Graft Loss at Month 84
outcomeMeasures.description: An analysis for the time to first occurrence of graft loss within month 84 (by means of Kaplan-Meier analysis) was done for all patients who suffered at least once from acute CMV infection (CMV viremia) during this study versus all patients who did not suffer from acute CMV infection (CMV viremia) during the study. Active CMV infection was defined as plasma polymerase chain reaction (PCR) ≥ 400 copies/millilitre (ml).

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Participants Who Had Lost Their Transplant or Died up to Month 84
Percentage of Participants With Graft Survival or Participant Survival at Month 24 and Every 12 Months up to Month 84
Number of Participants With Graft Rejections by CMV Status (Positive or Negative) of the Donor at Month 24 and Every 12 Months up to Month 84
Number of Graft Rejections by CMV Status (Positive or Negative) of the Donor at Month 24 and Every 12 Months up to Month 84
Creatinine Clearance at Month 24 and Every 12 Months up to Month 84
outcomeMeasures.description: Creatinine Clearance estimated by Cockcroft-Gault formula.
